resources.string: Design a manually controlled ROBOT wired or wireless within a specified dimension as mentioned in specifications below. The robot that will demolish the other robot in minimum time or minimum parts damaged of the robot will be declared winner.

Robot Specifications:  Maximum weight of the robot must be less than 55kg. Above this weight criteria, the robots will not be permitted to fight.  The maximum dimension of the robot must not exceed from 750mm x 750mm x 1000mm (l x b x h).  The length of the wire (for wired bots) should be long enough so that it can cover the arena and wire should remain slack during the war.  For any kind of accident college will not take any responsibility.  Use of Chemical spray and fire will not be allowed.Arena Specifications:  All the rounds will be on rectangular based arena.  The dimension for rectangular arena will be 12 feet * 12 feet (l x b)

General Rules:  Each team has to make their robots under the specifications given above.  Each team can have maximum 6 members. Students from different institutes can form a team.  No test practice will be allowed on the arena.  The robot should not damage the arena else it will lead to penalty, severely damage by the robot will lead to disqualification of the robot.  Each member of the team must have identity card of his/her respective institute.  Qualification to the next level is subjective and totally based on the judges.  Certificates of participation will be given to all the teams.  Unethical behaviour could lead to disqualification. Faculty coordinators have all the rights to take final decision for any matter during the event.  The necessary rules for playing the match will be explained on the day of event.  Maximum DC source voltage allowed is 24V.

Co-ordinator Information: 1. Hrushikesh Trada: hrushi2709@gmail.com, Ph. No. 7016024749 2. Vasu Patel: vasu26patel@gmail.com, Ph. No. 7405390190 3. Sagar Tejani: tejanisagard1997@gmail.com, Ph. No. 7573017203
